Html:
I have a resource dictionary defined in my <Application.Resources /> in my shell project. In my modules I can use the resources fine, but since the modules are decoupled from the shell until they are loaded at runtime the designer does not show them or recognize them.

Is there a way to make the modules aware of my resources at design time without merging my resource file in every view xaml?

My resource files are in a "common" project.

Hi,

I believe you might find those threads useful, where similar issues are addressed:

  • Add ability to create resource dictionaries shared between all modules
  • ResourceDictionary in a Module
  • Creating and Consuming Resource Dictionaries in WPF and Silverlight

I hope you find this helpful.

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadami

Thanks Agustin,

I have a solution that seems to be acceptable for now

Have set my resource dictionaries to "Resource" build action and using the design time resources for blend.
